Synopsis:
The father of the girl of fourteen Mattie Ross (Hailee Steinfeld) is shot dead in cold blood by the coward Tom Chaney (Josh Brolin), and now she is ready to do justice.

Seeking the help of the police chief Rooster Cogburn (Jeff Bridges), a trigger-happy drunk, leaves with him, despite his opposition to catch Chaney. Blood poured from his father to pursue criminal makes up the Indian territory and find him before the Texas Ranger named LaBoeuf catch him and take him back to Texas for the murder of another man.

Production notes:
Remake of the 1969 film of the same name starring John Wayne, itself based on the novel by Charles Portis.
